fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Work Completed on the Burnup Chart issue breakdown is summing up wrongly if the sprint has work scope decreased

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create Scrum Board and an issue with Zero Story points (optional)
# Create a new Sprint with the issue and Start
# Create new issue with Estimation of 2 Story Points on the Backlog
# Add the issue into an Active sprint
# Decrease the story point from 2 to 1 Story points
# Transition the Issue to Done
# Complete the Sprint

h3. Expected Result
The Work Completed in Sprint breakdown on the bottom of the burnup chart should show the transition from *0 -> 1* Story Points 

h3. Actual Result
Number of Work Completed is transitioning from *0 > -1* instead (work completed is being negative)
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-14 at 11.30.48 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround for completed Sprint
Or Prevent from Work Scope being reduced
fields.summary: Incorrect Completed Work for Burnup Chart when Work Scope decreases

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
same file name dropped creates attachment link in comment with wrong file name 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create new Issue
2. Create Comment to issue
3. Add an attachment to the issue with Drag and Drop (img 1.png) : screenshot comment.png
4. Create another Comment
5. Attach same file to the issue with Drag and Drop (again img 1.png): screenshot comment_1.png

Version Details : screenshot plugin version
Actual Jira Version - v8.13.3#813003-sha1:22ebedb
Jira Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin - 5.0.9


h3. Expected Results
It is expected that two files with the names img 1.png, img 1-1.png will be loaded, and links to the files will be visible in the comments.

h3. Actual Results
Two files are loaded with the names img 1.png, img 1-1.png
But in the comments, a link to the file name is always inserted img 1.png.
From the pop-up messages at the top right, you can see that the file is being downloaded with a new name.

h3. Workaround
As a short term fix:
* Modify the comment manually to choose the new attachment
* Use different file names while adding attachments to the Jira issue
fields.summary: same file name dropped creates attachment link in comment with wrong file name

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a configurer of an Agile board, similar to how I can configure my custom issue statuses to belong to one of the three options, I would also like to configure the columns on my agile board to be:
- {color:#205081}Not Started{color}
- {color:#f6c342}In Progress{color}
- {color:#8eb021}Done{color}

Currently the automatic assumption is that the very left column is {color:#205081}Not Started{color} and the very right column is {color:#8eb021}Done{color}.

This is a huge limitation in Jira Agile and causes problems especially with rendering the burndown chart.

I do not believe that asking the user to merge multiple of my columns into one or to create a separate Agile board is a sufficient solution for the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to add additional columns to also represent *Not Started* and *Done* in addition to the ability to already add an *In Progress* column.
 
h3. Note
Judging from the comments on GHS-10261 and GHS-11355 as well as [this post|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/218653/configuring-jira-agile-columns-for-notstarted-inprogress-and-done] on Atlassian Answers, I do feel that this is a feature of general interest.

Please stop closing every suggestion about this as "Answered" and leave any one of these three open for us to vote on.

Note: I am explicitly filing a duplicate of GHS-10261 and GHS-11355, both of which I find to have been closed prematurely.
fields.summary: In Configure Board, allow multiple "Not Started" (Blue) and "Done" (Green) columns

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when using text searching in the Quick Searching box, if the text custom field contains a number, jira doesn't list it in the results. Instead it searches for an Issue key with this number in the last browsed project. 

*Example:* The text custom field value contains 12345. Jira searches for IN-12345 (IN being the last project browsed).

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want to have both, search for the issue key as well as for the text in the custom field
 
h3. Workaround 
Enter the number as a wildcard instead. *Example:* 12345*
fields.summary: Text searching in Quick Searching box should also find numbers in a text custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As sub-tasks are unable to commit their value of the *Team* field (associated with Advanced Roadmaps for Jira) back to Jira Software, the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics is unable to display the correct information associated with this field.

For instance, if you create three different issues in Advanced Roadmaps, an Epic, a Story, and a Sub-task associated with the Story, assign these issues to a certain team (let's call it *Team A*) in Advanced Roadmaps and commit that information back to Jira, the gadget will display the selected team correctly for the *Epic* and the *Story*, but will display *None* as the selected value for the *Sub-task*.

Additionally, if you click on the gadget's information associated with the *Team A* field, the filter's results will be displayed, and you will see the sub-task listed under them.

Similarly, if you click on the *None* section, you will see no results being listed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3 issues in Advanced Roadmaps, in a certain project X an Epic, a Story, and a Sub-task associated with the Story, assign these issues to a certain team (let's call it *Team A*).
 # Commit that information back to Jira.
 # Create a filter Y that returns these three issues (for instance project = X and key in (X-1, X-2, X-3)).
 # Add the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget to a dashboard and select the *filter Y* as the *Saved Filter*. Select the *Sprint* field as the *XAxis* and the *Team* field as the *YAxis*.

h3. Expected Results
* The gadget would display the 3 issues as having the same team.

h3. Actual Results
* The gadget displays two issues having the correct team, and for the sub-task, it displays *None* as the value. 
* Additionally, if you click on the number of results that have the correct value, the resulting filter will correctly display the 3 issues.
* Furthermore, if you click on the *None* results, no issues are displayed.

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-27 at 22.14.23.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-27 at 22.14.42.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-27 at 22.15.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior other than not using sub-tasks. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps Team field causes Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget to display incorrect information

h3. Issue Summary

When clicking on Issues, Projects, or other header menu items, if the dropdown menu is longer than the browser height, the top bar is hidden and the browser must be resized to have the top bar back. (Scrolling does not help)

Affects Google Chrome.

It happens even when using the minimum supported screen resolution 1024x768.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and favorite some filters will increase the Issues dropdown menu height.
 # Resize the browser window to be smaller than the menu height.
 # Click on Issues top menu item

h3. Expected Results

Jira header menu (top bar) to be always visible and fixed at the top of the browser window.
h3. Actual Results

Jira header menu (top bar) gets hidden and it is not possible to click on menu items.
h3. Workaround

Resize the browser window and the top menu will be displayed again.

The popup message is not displaying the values intended. It shows object names/placeholder values. It does not affect 8.5.1 nor 8.13.2 .
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install 8.15 Jira Software Data Center
 # Create a Kanban software development project
 # Create 20+ issues

h3. Expected Results

A popup with the text below is expected to show (I confirmed the issues does NOT affect 8.5.1 nor 8.13.2):

  !image-2021-02-26-17-44-42-011.png|width=394,height=229!
h3. Actual Results

 

!image-2021-02-26-17-03-31-271.png|width=421,height=276!

To *disable* that popup entirely you can follow these steps:

Moving sprints can throw error stating permissions in other projects are required when we have sprints from other boards.

# Create sprint B on board B with all projects where you miss the Manage Sprint in at least one project

fields.description:
Some user stories consist of many (>10) tasks.  The sprint board adapts the story's swimlane length to accomodate all of them.

Our way of working is to add small tasks on the go.  So we will have some tasks in TODO, less tasks in "IN PROGRESS" and "REVIEW", and, after a while, many tasks in "DONE".

Now when e.g. during sprint review, or daily scrum, moving a number of tasks _to_ the DONE lane, they are appended to the list of other tasks, which shifts the focus down, forcing us to scroll up.

It would be more convenient to not change the current view while dragging tasks to DONE.
fields.summary: Don't shift the view when moving tasks to DONE on the scrum board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Standard mail handler behavior does not restrict itself to one project for issue comments. 
{quote}
 If an email message contains an issue key in its subject line and that issue key exists in your Jira installation, the *handler will add the email message content as a comment on the issue, regardless of which project the issue is in*.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option for mail handlers to be solely dedicated to a Project only including issue comments.

h3. Why This Is Important
Our customer base is increasing, such that there would be cases when an email meant for a dedicated project mail handler may contain a string in the subject that would coincidentally match an existing issue ticket.
When this happens, data in the email is misrouted: information for a new ticket in a specific project is instead commented on an unrelated issue ticket instead.


h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Option for Mail Handlers to be dedicated to a Project only

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Missing Rank field(s) value(s) in the "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" table can cause Ranking action (move issues up/down) to fail on Jira agile board.

 * Issues with Rank values missing and while trying to re-rank the issue on the Agile Board we get this error on the UI:
** Missing issue ID 15810 (PRG-123)
{code:sql}
jira854=# SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" WHERE "ISSUE_ID" = '15810';
 BUCKET | FIELD_ID | ID | ISSUE_ID | LOCK_HASH | LOCK_TIME | RANK | TYPE
--------+----------+----+----------+-----------+-----------+------+------
(0 rows)
{code}
** Trying rank this issue will throw this error in the UI
!2021-02-18_15-44-00.png|thumbnail!
* Currently Lexorank integrity checker does not identify these missing rank issues, all checks are green (/):
!2021-02-18_15-38-10.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Having this check with a reported number of issues that should have a Rank value but doesn't will help with the following:
# make it clear why we're getting this error on the UI
# take necessary action (reindex) on the issue to build a rank field value

h3. Workaround 
* Run this SQL query to identify the issues missing a Rank field value in the table:
{code:sql}SELECT jiraissue.id FROM jiraissue LEFT OUTER JOIN "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" ON jiraissue.id = "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"."ISSUE_ID" AND "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"."FIELD_ID" = '<RANK_CF_ID>' WHERE "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"."ISSUE_ID" IS NULL;{code}
* Depending on the number of issue IDs returned in the query you can either:
** Make a test modification on the issue (add a comment, transition the issue etc.)
** *a couple issues?*: Manually run this REST call to index the issue: 
{noformat}POST https://<BASE-URL>/rest/api/2/reindex/issue?issueId=<$ISSUE_ID>{noformat}
** *100s of issues?*: Write a small script and hit the above API for each issue IDs
** *1000s and more?*: Run a lock and reindexing

Technically, you can run any reindexing operation for this issue id(s) returned. However, based on the situation you're in you can choose from the options above.
fields.summary: Introduce Lexorank Healthcheck to identify issues with missing Rank field(s) value

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Mostly during the start of the day (when Jira has heavy login pressure from users), customer experienced a severe performance degradation (up to the point that system looks unresponsive). Upon further digging into thread dumps, we found 2 sets of problems:
 # A large number of threads waiting for *ReadLock*  (action - /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search)
 # At the same time, a group of thread waiting for a *WriteLock* (action - /plugins/servlet/samlconsumer)
 both on {{DirectoryUserIndexer.java}}.

This is caused by contention in the code and leads to situation, where a lot of threads (waiting for a ReadLock) are waiting on one thread that's supposed to get a WriteLock to update the {{UserIndex}}, but can't as it also waits on another thread which is currently having a ReadLock on {{UserIndex}} and doing the search.
This causes cascading contention and degrades user experience in Jira for other actions (see JSWSERVER-20336).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Details from the customer instance: 
* 300k+ user
* Massive amount of users logging in simultaneously at the start of the day
* Lot of action attempting to do {{@mention}} users at the same time

Have not attempted to repro in-house.

h3. Expected Results
Jira handles the start-of-the-day login pressure without hiccups

h3. Actual Results
* High load average: 
!2020-11-25_20-07-42.png|thumbnail!
* BLOCKED threads at {{com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.updateUserAndSetActiveFlag}}
{code}
thread_dump_9.txt
85
thread_dump_10.txt
84
thread_dump_11.txt
85
thread_dump_12.txt
84
thread_dump_13.txt
84
thread_dump_14.txt
85
{code}
* These threads are blocked by one WAITING thread which needs to get a WriteLock at at com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.search.DirectoryUserIndexer.refreshSearcher(DirectoryUserIndexer.java:127) 

h3. Notes
Related thread dumps. 
* *Synchronised* Threads waiting during authentication: 
{noformat}
"http-nio-9080-exec-637" #261926 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fb344586ef0 nid=0x5df0 waiting for monitor entry [0x00007fb28d24b000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.IndexedUserDao.update(IndexedUserDao.java:318)
	- waiting to lock <0x0000000145c5e268> (a java.lang.Object)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.DelegatingUserDao.update(DelegatingUserDao.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.SwitchingUserDao.update(SwitchingUserDao.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.CachingDirectory.updateUser(CachingDirectory.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.updateUserAndSetActiveFlag(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.updateUserFromRemoteDirectory(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RemoteDirectory.userAuthenticated(RemoteDirectory.java:592)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.userAuthenticated(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:281)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.userAuthenticated(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:278)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.userAuthenticated(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:2357)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.userAuthenticated(CrowdServiceImpl.java:109)
...
{noformat}
* Thread which waits for *WriteLock* at {{DirectoryUserIndexer.refreshSearcher}}
{noformat}
"http-nio-9080-exec-611" #256200 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fb3503bfaf0 nid=0xe398 waiting on condition [0x00007fb28ce47000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000145c5e1e8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$WriteLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:943)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.search.DirectoryUserIndexer.refreshSearcher(DirectoryUserIndexer.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.search.DirectoryUserIndexer.index(DirectoryUserIndexer.java:159)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.IndexedUserDao.update(IndexedUserDao.java:320)
	- locked <0x0000000145c5e268> (a java.lang.Object)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.DelegatingUserDao.update(DelegatingUserDao.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.SwitchingUserDao.update(SwitchingUserDao.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.CachingDirectory.updateUser(CachingDirectory.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.updateUserAndSetActiveFlag(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.updateUserFromRemoteDirectory(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RemoteDirectory.userAuthenticated(RemoteDirectory.java:592)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.userAuthenticated(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:281)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.userAuthenticated(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:278)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.userAuthenticated(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:2357)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.userAuthenticated(CrowdServiceImpl.java:109)
[...]
{noformat}
* RUNNABLE thread holding the *ReadLock* and executing the seach
{noformat}
"http-nio-9080-exec-635" #261922 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fb35030d5f0 nid=0x5dec runnable [0x00007fb28e3ab000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at org.apache.lucene.store.RAMFile.numBuffers(RAMFile.java:68)
	- locked <0x00000001d3000040> (a org.apache.lucene.store.RAMFile)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.RAMInputStream.setCurrentBuffer(RAMInputStream.java:125)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.RAMInputStream.nextBuffer(RAMInputStream.java:119)
....
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.search.DirectoryUserIndexer.internalSearch(DirectoryUserIndexer.java:262)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.search.DirectoryUserIndexer.search(DirectoryUserIndexer.java:228)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.IndexedUserDao.trySearching(IndexedUserDao.java:426)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.IndexedUserDao.search(IndexedUserDao.java:417)
...
{noformat}
** Note: {{DirectoryUserIndexer.internalSearch}}

h3. Workaround
Since problem is caused by a number of factors, we suggest to have multi-factor approach to reduce it:
* Descrese number of users in the system (if possible), to reduce the cost of computing  {{@mention}}
* Increase CPU cores to improve the time spent in the lock
* Identify bot user accounts creating unnatural login pressure
* Increase session timeout or remove bot-killer to reduce frequency of users needing to login/authenticate
fields.summary: Severe performance degradation for user mentions and user login action due to contention in IndexedUserDao

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to select "Remove the version" radio button when you try to delete the version on *Project > Releases* page. This happens when the version in releases is associated with "Version picker" custom field (_Single Select & Multiple Select both_)

This feature works on 7.13 (Tested on 7.12.3). However, it does not work on Jira 8.13/8.14.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a "Version Picker" type custom field (Name of the custom field: Custom field version in 8.14 & Version Picker Field in 7.12.3). Create 2 Releases/Versions - v1, v2.
 # Create a new issue. In Edit issue, associate the custom field (Test Version) with V1. Associate 'Fix Version'/Affected Versions field with V2.
 # Go to *Project* > *Releases* and try to delete V1. We will get a pop-up where we will have option to associate issues with V1 version to other versions. Here in "Custom field version" option, we are not able to select "Remove the version" radio button.
 !Screenshot 2021-01-28 at 8.32.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 (i) However, in Jira 7.13, this feature was available and we were able to select "Remove the version" radio button for the custom field.
 !Screenshot 2021-02-17 at 3.23.37 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to select "Remove the version" radio button for *Custom field version* also.
h3. Actual Results

In Jira 8.13/8.14, we are not able to select "Remove the version" radio button for *Custom field version*.
h3. Workaround

The same requirement could be achieved by associating single issues with multiple versions. Jira provides options to associate one issue with multiple versions.
 (i) Workaround depends on the user case.
fields.summary: Unable to select "Remove the version" radio button for "Version Picker" type custom field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you access an issue through a board's Issue Detail View, the Last Viewed value is not updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue.
 # Access the issue through the *Issue View Screen*. If you search for this issue and allow the *Last Viewed* value to be displayed in the issue navigator, you will notice that the value has just been updated.
 # Access a board that includes this issue.
 # Access this issue through the board's *Issue Detail View*.
 # Search again for the same issue.

h3. Expected Results
 # The *Last Viewed* value is updated.

h3. Actual Results
 # The *Last Viewed* value is not updated.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior other than accessing it through the *View Issue Screen*.
fields.summary: Accessing issues through the Issue Detail View does not update the Last Viewed value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the same issue has the sprint changed from Sprint A, then to Sprint B, and later on, to Sprint C, Sprint A shows the scope change but Sprint B does not show the issue and the scope change at the Burndown Chart and the Sprint Report.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Enable "Parallel Sprints" at the Admin > Applications > Jira Software Configuration
2. Create some stories a, b, c, d with 1 point each
3. Create sprint 1 
4. Add stories a e b to the sprint 1
5. Start sprint 1  (it will have 2 points to be done from the story a and story b)
6. Transition story a to done (remaining 1 point to be done from story b)
7. Create sprint 2
8. Edit story b and change the sprint to sprint 2, confirming the scope change
9. move story c  from the backlog to sprint 2 
10. Complete sprint 1 (1 point done, 1 point removed)
11. Start sprint 2 (2 points to be done from story b and story c)
12. Create sprint 3
13. Transition story c to done (1 point) 
14. Move story d from backlog to sprint 3
15. Edit story b and change the sprint to sprint 3, confirming the scope change


h3. Expected Results
Burndown Chart/Sprint Report for Sprint 2 was expected to be equal to the Burndown Chart /Sprint Report for Sprint 1
* Starting with 2 points, changing to 1 point;
* Scope change caused by story b


h3. Actual Results
For Sprint 2, Both Burndown report and Sprint Report do not show story b
The starting value, initially showing 2 points, is now starting at 1 point.
The scope change is not presented.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scope Change caused by moving issue to another sprint is only presented at the first time on the Burndown Chart and Sprint Report

Summary:
It appears the 'Look and Feel' is showing different display colour with same Settings when compared between Jira 8.13.1 and Jira 8.13.2. The issue is seen in Jira 8.14 as well.
h3. Steps to reproduce
* Navigate to Settings --> System --> Look and Feel
* Enter the configuration as seen mentioned in the attachment: Look n feel settings

"Header navigation - highlight background colour" is not updated correctly in Jira 8.13.2 and later versions of Jira. Please find the screenshot
Screenshot taken from Jira 8.13.1: Jira8.13.1
Screenshot taken from Jira 8.13.2: Jira8.13.2

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user completes all the subtasks under a parent task, Jira throws a Javascript error instead of "Move to done" pop up.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Sprint on a board.
# Create a parent issue and subtask under the issue.
# Start the Sprint
# From Active Sprint view, drag the subtask under the parent task to right most column.

Video: [^JSWSERVER-20837.webm] 

h3. Expected Results

Jira shows "Move to done" popup to ask if the user would like to move the parent task to the right most column (done column).

h3. Actual Results

Jira shows the following Javascript error:

+In Google Chrome+

{code}
Stack trace
TypeError: i(...).html is not a function
at Object.o.showDialog (http://jira.maeve.com/vicky/s/91dc5346f12ccff724bf6e2fba7b16ab-CDN/suo2v6/815001/6411e0087192541a09d88223fb51a6a0/bd395930f8ed93ae280f8b25b772c4b2/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid-work,greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global,atl.general,com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.init,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&baseurl-check-resources=true&flexboards=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-MY&whisper-enabled=true:6834:301)
at Object. (http://jira.maeve.com/vicky/s/91dc5346f12ccff724bf6e2fba7b16ab-CDN/suo2v6/815001/6411e0087192541a09d88223fb51a6a0/bd395930f8ed93ae280f8b25b772c4b2/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid-work,greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global,atl.general,com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.init,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&baseurl-check-resources=true&flexboards=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-MY&whisper-enabled=true:6892:9778)
{code}

+In Safari+

{code}
Exception: TypeError: i(".aui-blanket").html is not a function. (In 'i(".aui-blanket").html('')', 'i(".aui-blanket").html' is undefined)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Dismiss the Javascript error, refresh the page and the user can move the parent issue to the right most column manually.
fields.summary: Completing subtasks in parent task cause Javascript error on Active Sprint

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

Users with the "manage sprints" project permission are not able to create sprint or stop sprint, below error is seen:
{noformat}
You need the Manage Sprints permission for all the projects in the origin board to create a sprint
{noformat}
When you have a filter query with fields that span across other projects where the same user is not a project administrator or doesn't have the manage sprint permission. This happens despite having the filter constructed with project-specific, for more information, refer to the steps to replicate below.
h2. Steps to replicate
 # Create 2 projects with 1 issue each on the project (Project A and Project B)
 # Create a label (example of the field) and mark it on the issue for both project (example: {{labeling}}). This is to make sure the field's context incluudes both projects.
 # Grant the user project administration and manage sprint permission in project A
 # Ensure that the user has no such permission in project B
 # Create a board with the query below:
{noformat}
project = "Project A" and labels in (labeling) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}

 # Load the board for test user that follow the criteria given for step 3 and step 4

h2. Expected result

User is able to create sprint since the filter should only return issues from project A
h2. Actual result

User is unable to create sprint, they receive an error mentioning that they don't have permission.
h2. Workarounds

*Suggested*
 * Provide user "Manage Sprint" permission across all permission schemes

*Alternatives*
 * Create another temporary board without any sub query Eg: {{Project = TEST order by RANK ASC}}, create the sprint there. Use quick filter to filter the fields instead.
 * To start sprint, get administrator to initiate the sprint at this moment.
 * Provide a user "JIRA Administrator" Global Permission to Start/Stop any sprint
fields.summary: User with "Manage sprints" permission not able to manage the sprints when the board JQL filter contains fields with external context

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The DVCS plugin could throw an exception due to passing a large number of parameters while querying the DVCS table in order to create a list of the latest change sets.
The request (in this case, however there could be other triggers) was made by the Activity Stream gadget which calls DVCS.  In this case the end user did not notice any problems in the Jira application, however the exception thrown was often seen in the Jira log files.

*It is important to note that this issue can happen with any JDBC driver (perhaps with a different number of parameters), in this case it was found with the Microsoft SQL Server JDBC driver.  The issue is caused by the way the DVCS plugin  builds the query regardless of the JDBC driver.*

The way to identify this issue is by either:
# Ensuring that the stack trace writen to the Jira logs matches the one provided below in "Actual Results".
# Enabling SQL logging and finding the query issued by the DVCS plugin which should match the one provided below in "Actual Results - Additional Details"
 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
There are no specific steps to reproduce the issue.  It is mainly related to the Activity Strems and DVCS configuration.

h3. Expected Results
The DVCS plugin builds the SQL query required regardless of the number or parameters needed to fulfill the request.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the [Cumulative Flow Diagram|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Diagram] adding Columns extends the overall length of the *Refine Reports* report filter drop-down modal and will push the Columns choices beyond the pop-up window, with no option to scroll to the right.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple [Columns|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/jira-agile-tutorials/tutorial-adding-a-column-to-a-board] in the board configuration
 # on [Cumulative Flow Diagram|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Diagram]
 # Select Refine Report dropdown

h3. Expected Results

Ability to see all the Columns options
h3. Actual Results

The *columns values* are cut off:
 !image-2021-02-04-17-40-17-460.png|width=1550,height=754! 
  
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for now.
fields.summary: Cumulative Flow Diagram - Refine Report - Column choices run out of the drop down

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h6. Overview
By default, the _Apply_ button for the *Refine Report* feature is displayed properly as per the following screen shot:
!zoom_1.JPG|thumbnail!

However, once you zoom the page in, the _Apply_ button will disappear from the page with reference to the screen shot below:
!zoom_2.JPG|thumbnail!

With a screen resolution of 1366x768, this is reproducable without zooming. Having lots of quick filters, this happens more often since they take up space in the dialog.

h6. Environment tested
Google Chrome 34.0.1847.131 m, Mozilla Firefox 27.0
fields.summary: Columns being hidden in Cumulative Flow Diagram Column dropdown

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
!image-2021-02-04-21-27-54-110.png!
 # In the Jira Road Map Gadget it's possible to only provide the number of days for a release and not a particular date range. It would be really helpful if we can enter custom date range to list the releases between a specific start and end date.  This enable us to build views for 30 days, 60 days and 90 days by providing a mechanism to exclude results of 30 days in 60 days/90 days view.
 # Provide filtering options to sort the results in gadget. For example: ability to filter overdue release vs releases which are about to expire. Also ability to sort based on Jira project.
 # In the Release Report, it will be helpful to to add a line/break/divider post each release record in the list view so it’s easy for the eye to differentiate releases and connects the left column to the right column much better (in a row) – or any other way of making the easy eye linking will be fine as well
 # Ability to list results more than 50 (at least 200 releases at a time)

!image-2021-02-04-21-28-49-099.png!
fields.summary: Ability to sort various releases in Jira Roadmap gadget.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When right-clicking an issue on the Backlog view of a Scrum/Kanban board and selecting "View in Issue navigator", it leads to an error "Field 'cf[10000]' does not support sorting." on the Search page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an existing Scrum/Kanban board.
 # Navigate to the "Backlog" view;
 # Right click on an issue and choose "View in Issue navigator";

 - Scrum Board :
 !Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 6.53.04 PM.png|thumbnail!

 - Kanban Board :
 !Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 6.54.05 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The issue should navigate to the Search page without an Error and no additional "ORDER BY" statement is added in the advanced search JQL:
 !Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 7.02.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 7.02.34 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

An additional "ORDER BY" statement is added in the advanced search JQL and it ends up with an error on the Search page :
 !Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 6.56.51 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 6.56.14 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workarounds

1. Remove ORDER BY cf[10000] clause from advanced search JQL
fields.summary: "View in Issue navigator" adds an additional "ORDER BY" statement in advanced search JQL

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Provide the ability to customize the invitation e-mail (using the *Invite users* button).

h4. Workaround
{panel}
(!) Please, keep in mind that the below workaround is not official and falls under customization, which is not supported as per our 
[Support Offerings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-offerings-193299636.html]. So, please create a backup before following these steps!{panel}

# Stop Jira
# Go to *$JIRA_HOME/plugins/.osgi-plugins/transformed-plugins* (We recommend performing this action using Terminal or CMD)
# Edit the *jira-invite-user-plugin-X.X.X_XXXXXX.jar* file (the X's will be a different number, depending on your version)
(i) We will use the *vim* editor for this workaround, but, you can use your preferential tool to edit the *.jar* file. 
# Type enter on *jira-invite-user-plugin.properties* to edit it
# Scroll-down until *inviteuser.email.jira.invitation.body* then edit this section as your preference. You can paste URL's on it if you prefer
# Save the file
# Start your Jira
# Perform an invitation test, to make sure that the customization worked
fields.summary: Customize "Invite Users" E-mail invitation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to select Quick Filter for *Cumulative Report* not all filters can be seen in the *Refine Report* Dialog


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # set up several QuickFilters
 # open up Cumulative Report
 # go to Refine Report 

h3. Expected Results
All Filters are shown on several lines like here:
 !image-2021-02-02-13-37-24-156.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Filters are shown on one Line and not all Filters are visible :
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User unable to see all QuickFilter option in Cumulative Report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to end up with an epic issue which is a child of another epic issue. If you start with a story (which is a child of an epic) and move this issue to a different project, you have the option to change the issue type. If you select epic, the issue in the new project retains its child-association to the original epic.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a story issue and add it to an existing epic
 # Move the story issue to another project and change the issue type to epic
 # Notice in the original epic issue that the new epic shows up as a child issue still

h3. Expected Results

Epics should not be allowed to be children of other epics
h3. Actual Results

Epic becomes child of another epic
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving/changing issue type allows creation of a child-epic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Audit Log "Permission" category shows false "Summary"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Keep the Coverage level of *Security* in *Audit Log* to be selected as *Advanced* or *Full*
 # Access (_any_) project and it's issues using a non-adminn user.

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Let's consider the following scenario:
 * Issue ABC-123 is assigned to SprintXYZ.
 * ABC-123 is in status Open.
 * The board SprintXYZ belongs to doesn't have the Open status mapped to any column; it is an unmapped status.
 * SprintXYZ is started.
 * ABC-123 is transitioned from Open to To Do; To Do is mapped in the board. 
 * ABC-123 is marked as added to sprint after sprint start.

h5. +Notes+
 * Even if ABC-123 is directly transitioned to a status in the Done category, it will still be flagged as added to sprint after start time. 
 * If one of the issue's fields is changed so it's included in the board filter, it will not be flagged as added to sprint after start time. 

h3. Suggested Solution

The sprint reports should only look at when the Sprint custom field value was changed to find out if an issue was added to a sprint after start time. 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Issue is marked as added to sprint after start time if it transitions from an unmapped status to a mapped one

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary :
When 500 error is thrown it is displayed on the UI with via error page. This page lets you toggle through the error stack trace that was propagated. This stack seems to carry library information on every line.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Login to Jira
- Hit JIRA_BASE_URL/browser
- You should see screen as below with error code 500 and stack below:
 !Screenshot 2021-01-20 at 4.17.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
There should be a way to disable plugin information on stack trace.

h3. Actual Results
Sample exception trace:
{code:java}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: path is invalid
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.web.filter.BrowseProjectUrlHelper.<init>(BrowseProjectUrlHelper.java:60) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.web.filter.BrowseProjectRedirectFilter.doFilter(BrowseProjectRedirectFilter.java:58) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.core.filters.AbstractHttpFilter.doFilter(AbstractHttpFilter.java:32) [atlassian-core-7.0.2.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:62) [atlassian-plugins-servlet-5.2.3-96cf760eb.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:37) [atlassian-plugins-servlet-5.2.3-96cf760eb.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.lambda$doFilter$0(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:57) [atlassian-plugins-servlet-5.2.3-96cf760eb.jar:?]
{code}

h3. Workaround
Within the logs if same exception is thrown, library information can be suppressed by modifying the respective conversion pattern from:
{code:java}
ConversionPattern=%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss,SSSZ} %t %p %X{jira.username} %X{jira.request.id} %X{jira.request.assession.id} %X{jira.request.ipaddr} %X{jira.request.url} [%q{2}] %m%n
{code}
to 
{code:java}
ConversionPattern=%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss,SSSZ} %t %p %X{jira.username} %X{jira.request.id} %X{jira.request.assession.id} %X{jira.request.ipaddr} %X{jira.request.url} [%q{2}]
{code}
fields.summary: Any 500 server error series displays stack trace on UI with library information

h3. Issue Summary

Some issues removed from sprints are no showing under the '*Issues Removed From Sprint*' section when looking at the Sprint Report, when moving the issue from *Sprint* to *Sprint*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Sprint A*
 # Create a *Sprint B*
 # *Create a* *Sprint C*
 # Create some issues (Issue 1, Issue 2, Issue 3) *and move them to Sprint A*
 # Start *Sprint A*
 # Move the *Issue 1* from *Sprint A* to *Sprint B*
 # Complete *Sprint A* - incomplete issues go to backlog
 # Check the *'Issue Removed From Sprint'* section in the *Sprint Report* (*Issue 1* should correctly show as removed from Sprint A) ** 
 # Move *Issue 2* and *Issue 3* to *Sprint B*
 # Start *Sprint B*
 # Move again the *Issue 1* to *Sprint C*
 # Complete *Sprint B*
 # Check the '*Issue Removed From Sprint*' section in the Sprint Report from *Sprint B,* we will see that *Issue 1* will be missing.

 Sample video: 

[^Issue Removed from Sprint bug.mov]
h3. Expected Results

Issue 1 is listed in the '*Issue Removed From Sprint*' section in the Sprint Report from *Sprint B*

!image-2021-01-19-12-36-38-379.png|width=1113,height=415!
h3. Actual Results

Issue 1 is *not* listed in the '*Issue Removed From Sprint*' section in the Sprint Report from *Sprint B*

!image-2021-01-19-12-32-39-967.png|width=1140,height=357!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

The current integration with Github only uses user based rate limit which causes the limit to be reached easily specially when the user does some API requests that adds to the limit.

fields.description:
The CFD diagram is nearly indecipherable once a project ramps up and has a large historical amount of issues closed.

What ends up happening is you have a large stack of done issues, and a tiny sliver of others at the top.

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/221612/221612_cfd_before.png!

For the CFD to be useful, you really want "Done" to reset to 0 (or near 0), otherwise, you can't really analyze the diagram. Basically, whatever date is the start date we're analyzing in the diagram, hide all resolved items preceding that date.

As a user reported in JRASERVER-64003, a quick filter is a workaround but it's clumsy, especially if you zoom on different time periods.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira calendar under *Backlog* screen doesn't respect *ISO8601 standard in Date Picker* setting under *Look & Feel*

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Navigate to *Administration > System > Look and Feel* and set *use ISO8601 formatting for date pickers* to *Yes*.
- Navigate to an existing or create a new Agile Scrum board.
- Create a version using the *Release* sidebar under *Backlog* view.
 !Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 7.06.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 7.07.01 PM.png|thumbnail! 
- Navigate to *Backlog* screen and check the calendar under *Sprint*
 !Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 7.14.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 
- Observe that the week number has not changed like the calendar in version screen and it seems it doesn't respect the *ISO8601* setting under Look & Feel.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should consistently use the ISO8601 setting for all the calendars in the respective sections.

h3. Actual Results

Jira Agile does not apply this setting, as a result, the Week number in these calendars in an inconsistent manner.

*Notes*

This can be seen under:

Board -> Configure -> Working Days -> Non Working Days -> Add Date

h3. Workaround

# Modify *Calendar.setup.js* by doing *vi* to {{atlassian-jira/includes/lib/calendar/Calendar.setup.js}} and modify *useISO8601WeekNumbers* to *true* 
# Refresh the the resource in the page using *disabled cache* (Under Developer tools) while reloading the tab.

(i) Above steps will help you fix the sprint board widget(as you will notice after checking the video). Release page is handled by another in-built module and has different way to have iso week Initialized and this gets handled by *look and feel* settings you already have in place.

(flag) If the above step didn't help, kindly do a *vi* as below and verify that it would be nice:

{code:java}
vi atlassian-jira/includes/lib/calendar/Calendar.setup-min.js
{code}

 !Screenshot 2021-04-12 at 8.34.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 

If that is the case, please *modify it to !0 instead of !1* to make it *true* and try reloading the page with cache disabled, that should work.
fields.summary: Jira calendar under "Backlog" screen doesn't respect "ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" setting under "Look & Feel"

fields.description:
Whenever you convert other issue types to sub-task, users are able to select Epics as the parent issue for these sub-tasks. 

Potentially, this feature can cause confusion among users, regarding the epic being the parent of the sub-tasks (and being displayed on the Epic's *Sub-tasks* section), with the *Parent-Child* relationships commonly seen between Epics and Stories, using the *Epic Link* field.

It would be great if Jira Administrators could prevent this from happening during the conversion process. You can trigger the process by:

# Navigate to a certain issue of a different issue type.
# Click on the *More* button and select *Convert to sub-task*.
# You will be taken to the *Convert Issue to Sub-task: <Issue_Key>* page.
# There, you will see the *Select Parent Issue*.
# In this section, it would be great if Administrators could prevent the Epics associated with this project from being listed as options.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to prevent epics from being select as a parent issue while converting issues to sub-task

h3. Issue Summary

If Jira crashes during a rebalancing, the {{LOCK_HASH}} column keeps the lock, and it has to be manually cleaned, following [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/ranking-failed-due-to-lock_hash-is-not-null-953658654.html].

# Start Lexorank rebalancing

The balance works correctly.

We can observe the following error in the {{atlassian-greenhopper.log}}:
{noformat}
2020-12-21 15:11:31,668 lexorank-executor-thread-0 WARN      [service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankScheduledBalanceHandler] Balance for fieldId=10105 returned errors: Errors: 10105
Error Messages: [Jira Software cannot execute the rank operation at this time. Other users may be ranking the issues that you are trying to rank. Please try again later.]
{noformat}

Follow the procedure described in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/ranking-failed-due-to-lock_hash-is-not-null-953658654.html].

fields.description:
h2. Title :

Disable populating the database table AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER table when Batching feature is disabled
h2. Summary :

Currently, even if the Batching notifications is disabled in Jira, the application still writes to the table AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER in the database.
h4. Steps to replicate
 * Disable batched notificaitons
 * Make any random update to any Jira ticket
 In this case, this table keeps recording rows related to these actions.

h2. Expected results
This table should not record new rows related to these actions, since they are not used because the batched notifications are disabled.

h2. Actual results
This table keeps recording new rows related to these actions.

h2. Workaround

The only way to disable the writing into this table is by disabling the below system plugins.
 (on) *Not suggested to for prod environments as it may cause multiple other issues*
 The below plugins have to disabled in the same order as below and should be enabled back in the reverse order* -
 * Jira inform - batchers
 * Jira inform - batching plugin
 * Jira inform - event plugin
fields.summary: Disable populating the database table AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER table when Batching feature is disabled

fields.description:
Most MDM providers offer some sort of SSO implementation that is initiated at the device level. This allows users to sign in once on the device and then use any apps that are managed without having to be bothered by additional security measures such as 2FA or redirecting for login.
 According to our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/mobile-device-management-mdm-979410052.html], we don't currently support this:
||MDM Function||Supported for Jira Server app||
|App deployment|Yes|
|App configuration|Yes - to pre-populate the site URL only|
|App tunnel|Yes |
|Single sign-on (SSO)|No|
|Access control|No|
|Security policies|No|

It would be nice to support this.
fields.summary: Allow Device or application level SSO for the Jira Mobile App

h3. Issue Summary

When transitioning an issue to a status that contains multiple transitions available to the same status, however with different resolutions, for example, doesn't display the available transitions and instead picks a random one based on the ID. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 8.x
 # Create a Kanban project
 # Create multiple transitions from one status to another
 # Drag and drop an issue to that status with multiple transitions

h3. Expected Results

All the available transitions are displayed, so you can transition the issue to a different resolution, for example.

h3. Actual Results

No transition is available, and the system will transition to the transition with the lowest ID.
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-09 at 12.37.32.png|thumbnail! 


Previously in Jira 7, all the transitions were displayed:

 !Screen Shot 2020-12-09 at 12.36.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
It appears from the following articles that JQL does not support a query that would identify JIRAs that have the assigned user = the created user. 

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Help-with-JQL-assignee-reporter/qaq-p/235952]
[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Assignee-not-same-as-reporter/qaq-p/201834]

At a minimum, we would like to report on these so that we can follow-up.  In addition to creating a search filter for these we would like to stop JIRAs from being opened or closed if the create user is the same as the assigned user. We would also like to restrict that the assigned user cannot close the JIRA. Can this be done even though JQL doesn't appear to support these types of queries?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issues that are created with an epic link at creation time won't show in the epic burndown report. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issues and set epic link *at creation time* to "Epic A" for instance. 
# Add those issues in a sprint called "Sprint 1". 
# Start and complete "Sprint 1". 
# Open the Epic Burndown report for "Epic A". 

h3. Expected Results
All issues that have Epic Link set to "Epic A" should appear under "Sprint 1". 

h3. Actual Results
Only the issue that have a change history item where Epic Link has changed will appear under the sprint in Epic Burndown. 

h3. Workaround
Clearing the setting the Epic Link will make the issue appear. This will fix existing issues. 

For issues to be created in the future: 
* The Epic Link should be removed from the Issue Create screen. 
* The users should be educated not to clone issues. 

h3. Notes
The problem doesn't impact *Epic Report*.
fields.summary: Epic burndown doesn't show issues where the epic link field hasn't changed

fields.description:
h3. Problem

There is no unique constraint in AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING.slug column and hence, however the DVCS code expects a unique value in that specific column.  If duplicate values are found in {{AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING}} then the below error will be written to the atlassian-jira log file.
{code:java}
2020-11-24 22:10:30,938+0000 Caesium-1-4 ERROR ServiceRunner [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsScheduler:job' failed
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Multiple entries with same key: example-repo=[https://server/data/example-repo], example-repo, true, false, true and example-repo=[https://server/data/example-repo], example-repo, true, false, true. To index multiple values under a key, use Multimaps.index.
{code}
h3. Workaround
An attempt to add a unique constraint to avoid duplicates was tested and led to other problems hence, there is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Duplicate values in AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING leads to DVCS sync job failure.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cookies for session stickiness that is for "child domains" (starts with dots, see RFC6265) are filtered out on IOS Jira Server Mobile 1.16. As result after auth in WebView, rest calls got on wrong node and client receives 401 (unauth) causing Session Expire loop.
h3. Impacts
 * data-center instances
 * session stickiness based on domain with allowed subdomains (aka starts from dot)

e.g. SSO returns

{{Set-Cookie: session_cookie=some-guid;Domain=.foo.bar}}
h3. Workaround

Absent, please use web client and watch this issue. If you use Jira iOS 1.15.0 or older version, don't update the app to new versions for a while. 

The fix in iOS mobile client is needed.
fields.summary: Loop session timeout in Jira Server iOS since 1.16.0 for "dotted" domain paths in cookies with DC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Velocity chart show wrong committed story points if issues are coming from another sprint and removed during the sprint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Scrum project create *2 stories* and *2 sprint* (*sprint a* and *sprint b*)
 # Add the 2 stories to *sprint a*, estimate them with 3 story points each *but don't start the sprint.*
 # Move the 2 stories to *sprint b* and *start sprint b*.
 # While sprint b is still open, move one of the 2 issues out of the sprint.
 # Complete sprint b.
 # Open the Velocity Chart and observe that *the gray bar with the committed story points only show 3 story points when there should be 6*. *The Story points committed for the issue which is moved out from the sprint b while was still in progress are not anymore included in the gray bar*:
 !Screenshot 2020-11-26 at 15.39.35.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results

As default behaviour, the gray bar in velocity chart for each sprint shows the total estimate of all issues in the sprint when it begins disregarding if some are removed before the end of the sprint.
h3. Actual Results

Velocity Chart doesn't show committed story points if issues are coming from another sprint and removed during the sprint.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Velocity chart show wrong committed story points if issues are coming from another sprint and removed during the sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue through the incoming mail handler, hidden fields get data applied if there is a default value for the the field. This is unexpected and differs from creating an issue through the 'Create' button in the UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up incoming mail handler and apply to a project
 # Create a custom field like multi select with more than one option and a default value applied.
 # Add this field to the project configured for the incoming mail handler, and hide it in the field configuration.
 # Create an issue through the incoming mail handler - using the 'Where's my field' against your hidden custom field to observe the hidden field does not appear - but is NOT missing from the screen because there is no value.
 # Create an issue in the same project through the Create button, using the 'Where's my field' against your hidden custom field to observe the field does not appear - but IS missing partly due to that the field DOES NOT have a value.

h3. Expected Results

Hidden custom field would not have its default value applied.
h3. Actual Results

Hidden custom field has the default value set as current selected data.
h3. Workaround

None currently, as the incoming mail handler has no option for this behavior.
fields.summary: Issue created by incoming mail handler applies the configured default value to hidden fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User isn't added to default group setup in the connector if the user is a member of that same group in the remote directory and *Use the User Membership Attribute, when finding the members of a group* is unchecked.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect to an external directory
 # Setup the LDAP settings as follows:

 * LDAP Permissions
 ** Read Only, with Local Groups: Yes
 ** Default Group Memberships: jira-users
 * Advanced settings
 ** Update group memberships when logging in: Every time the user logs in
 * Membership Schema Settings
 ** Use the User Membership Attribute
 *** When finding the user's group membership: Unchecked
 *** When finding the members of a group: Unchecked

 # Login with a  new user or existing user who's part of the *jira-users* group in the remote directory.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be added to *jira-users* after they login successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The user is not added to the default group.
h5. Notes

If the user is not a member of *jira-users* in the remote directory, the issue won't occur. 
 Default membership is updated without a problem.
h3. Workaround

Check *Use the User Membership Attribute: When finding the members of a group*.
fields.summary: User isn't added to default group if the user is a member of that same group in the directory and "Use the User Membership Attribute, when finding the members of a group" is unchecked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users lacking the 'Edit Issues' permission are not able to link an Epic to newly created or existing issues. However, despite an error message when performing this action, a new issue is still created and the workflow is left in a broken state for that issue.

This issue was introduced in JSW *8.11.0* and is not occurring in *8.10.1*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two Software projects.
 # Remove '*Edit Issues*' permission in the Project A permission scheme.
 # Create an Epic in '*Project A*'.
 # Create a new issue (or edit existing issue) in '*Project B*' with the Epic Link assigned to the Epic created in step 3.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is not created because the user does not have the appropriate permission. See JSWSERVER-13986 for related suggestion.
h3. Actual Results

As of 8.11, the user gets an unclear error message that is shown in the screenshot and the impression the issue isn't submitted:
{code:java}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{code}

However:
# The issue is created without the Epic Link or required fields.
# The {{os_wfentry.state}} for the issue is set to 0 so no workflow transition button appears on the view issue screen.

h5. New Issue

!NewIssue.png|width=602,height=74!
{code:java}
/secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.a.j.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Error creating issue:
com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: You do not have permission to edit issue PROJECTA-1.
{code}
{{OS_WFENTRY}}:
||ID||NAME||INITIALIZED||STATE||
|10601|Software Simplified Workflow for Project SCRUM|NULL|0|
h5. Existing Issue

!ExistingIssue.png|width=595,height=41!
{code:java}
/secure/QuickEditIssue.jspa [c.a.j.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Exception occurred editing issue: java.lang.RuntimeException: You do not have permission to edit issue PROJECTA-1.
java.lang.RuntimeException: You do not have permission to edit issue PROJECTA-1.
{code}
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to:
 # Search for the new issue – either by direct URL or through the database.
 # Add the required fields and Epic Link (under a user that has permission).
 # Fix the workflow with the KB [Workflow transition button missing from the issue view page in Jira server.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/workflow-transition-button-missing-from-the-issue-view-page-in-jira-server-800304645.html]

{panel:bgColor=#fff8c9}
(i) Always back up your data before performing any modifications to the database. If possible, test any alter, insert, update, or delete SQL commands on a staging server first.
{panel}
fields.summary: Unable to link Epic without Edit Issue permissions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[A customer's DBA found that queries on the AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING uses varchar(4000) instead of varchar(255) to reference the column NODE|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PS-68878?focusedCommentId=24315805&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-24315805].
 In addition, Chris from DVCS channel mentions:
 Most of these queries are constructed by AO so this isn’t something configured explicitly. The NODE column is used to store the git commit hash and right now there is no explicit length set on the column so i suspect that’s why AO is defaulting to 4k.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Updating varchar(4000) to varchar(255) significantly drops the logical reads from 10k+ to 7, and speeds up the execution time from 290+ms to 0ms.
 These numbers are just for a join query involving AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING table, however them mentioned majority of the queries are set the same way.
 Versions involved:
 *DB:* SQL Server 13.0 (SQL Server 2016)
 *DB Driver:* Microsoft JDBC Driver 7.2 for SQL Server 7.2.1.0
 *DVCS version:* 5.2
 *Jira version:* 8.5.3
h3. Expected Results

Updating varchar(4000) to varchar(255) significantly drops the logical reads from 10k+ to 7, and speeds up the execution time from 255ms to 0ms.
{code:sql}
SET STATISTICS IO, TIME ON
GO
declare @p1 int
declare @p2 int
declare @p7 int
set @p7=1
exec sp_cursorprepexec @p1 output,@p2 output,N'@P0 varchar(255),@P1 int',N'SELECT chm.PARENTS_DATA,chm.FILE_DETAILS_JSON,chm.FILES_DATA,chm.FILE_COUNT,chm.ISSUE_KEY,chm.SMARTCOMMIT_AVAILABLE,chm.VERSION,chm.REPOSITORY_ID,chm.AUTHOR_EMAIL,chm.RAW_NODE,chm.RAW_AUTHOR,chm.MESSAGE,chm.AUTHOR,chm."DATE",chm.ID,chm.BRANCH,chm.NODE,chm.PROJECT_KEY FROM dbo.AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING chm JOIN dbo.AO_E8B6CC_REPO_TO_CHANGESET rtchm ON chm.ID = rtchm.CHANGESET_ID WHERE chm.NODE = @P0 AND rtchm.REPOSITORY_ID = @P1 ',4104,8193,@p7 output,N'a10b0b00dfd03b2d7fc32f77968a1ef84bc26e2a',188
select @p1, @p2, @p7
(0 rows affected)
Table 'Worktable'. Scan count 0, logical reads 2, physical reads 0, read-ahead reads 0, lob logical reads 0, lob physical reads 0, lob read-ahead reads 0.
Table 'AO_E8B6CC_REPO_TO_CHANGESET'. Scan count 1, logical reads 6, physical reads 0, read-ahead reads 0, lob logical reads 0, lob physical reads 0, lob read-ahead reads 0.
Table 'AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING'. Scan count 1, logical reads 7, physical reads 0, read-ahead reads 0, lob logical reads 5, lob physical reads 0, lob read-ahead reads 0.
SQL Server Execution Times:
CPU time = 0 ms, elapsed time = 0 ms.
SQL Server Execution Times:
CPU time = 0 ms, elapsed time = 0 ms.
{code}
h3. Actual Results

The actual captured sql query statistics show that the query uses varchar(4000) to reference the column NODE, which results in 10k+ logical reads and 290+ms execution time.
{code:sql}
SET STATISTICS IO, TIME ON
GO
declare @p1 int
declare @p2 int
declare @p7 int
set @p7=1
exec sp_cursorprepexec @p1 output,@p2 output,N'@P0 Nvarchar(4000),@P1 int',N'SELECT chm.PARENTS_DATA,chm.FILE_DETAILS_JSON,chm.FILES_DATA,chm.FILE_COUNT,chm.ISSUE_KEY,chm.SMARTCOMMIT_AVAILABLE,chm.VERSION,chm.REPOSITORY_ID,chm.AUTHOR_EMAIL,chm.RAW_NODE,chm.RAW_AUTHOR,chm.MESSAGE,chm.AUTHOR,chm."DATE",chm.ID,chm.BRANCH,chm.NODE,chm.PROJECT_KEY FROM dbo.AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING chm JOIN dbo.AO_E8B6CC_REPO_TO_CHANGESET rtchm ON chm.ID = rtchm.CHANGESET_ID WHERE chm.NODE = @P0 AND rtchm.REPOSITORY_ID = @P1 ',4104,8193,@p7 output,N'a10b0b00dfd03b2d7fc32f77968a1ef84bc26e2a',188
select @p1, @p2, @p7
(0 rows affected)
Table 'Worktable'. Scan count 0, logical reads 3, physical reads 0, read-ahead reads 0, lob logical reads 0, lob physical reads 0, lob read-ahead reads 0.
Table 'AO_E8B6CC_REPO_TO_CHANGESET'. Scan count 1, logical reads 6, physical reads 0, read-ahead reads 0, lob logical reads 0, lob physical reads 0, lob read-ahead reads 0.
Table 'AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING'. Scan count 1, logical reads 10584, physical reads 0, read-ahead reads 0, lob logical reads 5, lob physical reads 0, lob read-ahead reads 0.
SQL Server Execution Times:
CPU time = 297 ms, elapsed time = 293 ms.
SQL Server Execution Times:
CPU time = 297 ms, elapsed time = 293 ms.
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira DVCS queries on the table AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING uses varchar(4000) instead of varchar(255) to reference the column NODE

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing text in a comment and hitting CTRL+Z or CMD+Z to undo some text entry, the textbox focus might go all the way to the bottom in some cases.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you're using either Chrome or Safari.
# Navigate to any Jira issue and click *Comment.*
# Ensure you're on *Text* mode.
# Enter a few paragraphs of text, for example, the lorem ipsum below:
{code:none}
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus pellentesque, eros sed sodales posuere, dolor sem malesuada ante, sed dignissim dui mi ac dui. {code}
# *Type* the following text at the very beginning:
{code:none}
Some text I'll want to undo
{code}
# Hit CTRL+Z or CMD+Z to undo text entry.


h3. Expected Results
The entered text is undone, and the focus on the textbox will stay unchanged.

h3. Actual Results
The focus on the textbox will be moved to the very bottom. The text cursor will remain on the same place as before, though.

Here's a short video demonstrating the behavior:  [^video.mov] 


(!) *This issue is reproducible in Chrome 86.0.4240.193 and Safari 14.0, but not in Firefox 82.0.3.*
(!) *Reproducibility seems to be dependant on two factors:*
* Lenght of the text.
* Width of the textbox.

If at first the issue does not seem reproducible, try the following:
* Resize the browser window to reduce its width.
* Expand the sidebar in Jira.

h3. Workaround
* Increase the width of the browser window, or use Firefox.
fields.summary: Hitting CTRL+Z or CMD+Z to undo text entry may cause the textbox to scroll to the bottom

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently when Jira tries to send a mail to a group of users, it validates the email addresses for all users before sending the mail. If any of the users have an invalid email (eg because they have departed the organisation etc) then the entire mail will not be sent and will go on the error queue.

We could set the javaxmail sendPartial flag as a command line option, and then the emails would be sent, but Jira still sees it as a failed operation and puts it on the queue to resend (resulting in a loop).

In our organisation we have a large team who often have people leaving the organisation, and this breaks emails for the team.

Jira should allow mails to be delivered to all users with valid email addresses, ignoring invalid email addresses.
fields.summary: Add support for JavaMail sendPartial flag in Jira

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There are different reasons because of which the same sprint(with same id) appears on multiple boards:
 * a board is cloned and hence the same filter is being used on the cloned board and the same sprint now shows up on 2 boards
 * a board is created with a filter which searches on Sprint ID
 * a new board is created with a filter which overlaps with the filter for another board. All sprints linked to issues from overlapping filter will now show on the new board.

When this scenario occurs, the results of changes to sprint on any one board can impact the other boards as well. This creates confusion to the users of the other boards.

+*Confusing scenario example 1:*+
 * The Sprint is started on the board with a subfilter of the issues from the original board.
 * At this point a pop up appear stating with a message which should warn the customer that the original Sprint contains much more issues:!Screenshot_2020-10-21_at_13_37_05.jpg|thumbnail!

(i) However the message is not clear and the result is that customer browse a board which contains much more issues.
 * In fact when the same sprint is completed, another popup appears:!Screenshot_2020-10-21_at_13_37_27.jpg|thumbnail!

Again Jira reports the total number of issues that are incomplete and which will be moved to the next sprint or to the backlog, that we cannot see on the board since the board doesn't filter those.

+*Confusing scenario example 2:*+
 Another similar situation happens when *deleting the sprint* from the 2nd board (not the original one), user will see only some of the issues moved to the future sprint or to the backlog when there are in fact *much more actually moved*.

Moreover, when looking at the Agile reports both for the board which filter a subfilter of the original one and the one which filter in the original ones plus more issues, obviously the results on reports will be different cause they will contain respectively less or more issues.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please provide more clear advice messages to clarify those situations both in:
 * Sprint Start/Complete popup.
 * Agile reports pages.
 * Sprint deletion popup

Perhaps a message similar to this one can be added to the Sprint screens mentioning:

*_"The Sprint 'Sprint-1' appears on the following boards. Making changes to the sprint here will impact all the boards"_*  !Screenshot 2020-11-12 at 13.43.13.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

When creating new boards, try to create boards with overlapping filters only if absolutely necessary. Please keep in mind that creating boards with overlapping filters can be very confusing for the users.
fields.summary: As a user I need more clear messages and advices about the manipulation of a Sprint on multiple boards

h3. Issue Summary

Create board buttons are displayed to users without permissions "*Create Shared Objects",* only to fail at the end of the create board wizard. The buttons should be disabled/hidden
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user without "*Create Shared Objects"* permission
 # Go to Boards>View all boards
 # You'll see create board button as well as a link in the content sections of there are no boards to see

h3. Expected Results

Users without permission doesn't have create board button/button is disabled
h3. Actual Results

User can go through create board wizard only to fail at the final step with an error message
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create board buttons are displayed to users without permissions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, it is only _after_ a team fills up their sprint with backlog items and clicks *Start Sprint* that Jira helpfully reminds them that perhaps they should have a goal for the sprint – and probably many people would argue that there are several [advantages of using a Sprint Goal|https://www.scrum.org/resources/blog/11-advantages-using-sprint-goal].

Jira would be even more helpful, though, if it would make this reminder not only _after_ the sprint backlog is decided, but rather _before_ the team has started deciding which backlog items' fulfilment would help them to reach the goal they've agreed on.

The prompt could come, for example, when a user clicks on *Create Sprint*.

Possible?

This suggestion is related to JSWSERVER-7308.
fields.summary: Prompt users to enter a Sprint Goal when they create a sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Running a search with keywords in the backlog search (planning view) does not search the Description field. The search only returns the issues having the keyword in the summary, but not in the description.

However, running the same search under _*Issues > Search for issues*_ returns all the issues with the keyword in the summary and in the description, as expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Scrum project.
 # Create an issue A with the keyword "rockstar" in summary.
 # Create another issue B with the same keyword "rockstar" in the description.
 # Under _*Project > Backlog*_, you should see both issues in the backlog.
!Screenshot 2020-11-05 at 10.42.15.png|width=183,height=68!
 # On the same page, use the search field to search with the keyword "rockstar".

h3. Expected Results

Both issues A and B should be returned in the results.
h3. Actual Results

Only issue A (with "rockstar" in summary) is returned in the search results.

Also, running the same search under _*Issues > Search for issues*_ returns both issues A and B.

!Screenshot 2020-11-05 at 10.42.27.png|width=235,height=88!

!Screenshot 2020-11-05 at 10.41.59.png|width=211,height=103!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Search with keywords in backlog doesn't check description field
